      void HandleMouseDrag​(int x, int y)
      React to a MouseDrag on (x,y): if the scrollbar is active and we're dragging, change the handle position accordingly
      void HandleMousePress​(int x, int y)
      React to a MousePress on (x,y): if the scrollbar is active and (x,y) is on the scrollbar: if it's on the handle, start dragging else if the click is above the handle move it up a bit else the click is below the handle, move it down a bit
      void HandleMouseRelease​(int x, int y)
      React to a MouseRelease on (x,y): if the scrollbar is active stop dragging
      void HandleReset()
      Does nothing.

      void setWidth​(int width)  
      void updateHandleHeight​(int totalHeight)
      Changes the size of the handle with start height divided by the current height of the scrollbar

        public void HandleMousePress​(int x,
                             int y)
        React to a MousePress on (x,y): if the scrollbar is active and (x,y) is on the scrollbar: if it's on the handle, start dragging else if the click is above the handle move it up a bit else the click is below the handle, move it down a bit
        Specified by:
        HandleMousePress in class ViewModel
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the mouse
        y - the y position of the mouse
